paper_abstract: The modeling of migration of hydrogen produced by the corrosion of the nuclear waste packages in an underground storage including the dissolution of hydrogen involves a set of nonlinear partial differential equations with nonlinear complementarity constraints. This article shows how to apply a modern and efficient solution strategy, the Newton-min method, to this geoscience problem and investigates its applicability and efficiency. In particular, numerical experiments show that the Newton-min method is quadratically convergent for this problem. (C) 2013 IMACS. Published by Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Gas phase appearance and disappearance as a problem with complementarity constraints
